page.title: 18CONTINUED
page.content: infestation of black ants. Then, at 1.40 p.m., continued on to Locharbriggs to check a property for mice. He then travelled to Heathhall at 2.15. At 2.20 p.m., Mr. Seddon inspecfted the loft area of a terraced house and removed a wasps nest (Last year's and unoccupied) for the tenants piece of mind! Then, at 2.30 p.m., he went to Heathhall Airfield and carried out routine preventative checks (anti-rats). At 3.35 p.m., he travelled back into Dumfries. At 3.45 p.m., he then did a routine check of the river bank from Buccleuch Street to St. Michael's Bridge for rats. Mr. Seddon then went, at 4.20 p.m., to check property near Whitesands. At 4.50 p.m., he returned to the office to complete the day's paper work.<
